item.title: Question 1:
item.description:
A continuous Random Vector has a joint probability density function given by
if 0< y < 1 and x > y.

Are X and Y independent? Please Justify your answer.

Calculate the conditional probability density functions of X given Y and Y given X.


To determine if or are independent, we need to check if the joint probability density function can be expressed as the product of the marginal probability density functions and .

item.title: Stats
item.description:
Week 5
Method of moments, Maximum Likelihood Estimate
Week 8
Empirical distribution, sample variance, sample proportion, sampling observations
Week 9
Empirical distribution function, Variance Reduction,
Chi squared distribution, it's relation
tn distribution, generating it.
Normal plot, t plot, normal vs t plot,
Markov Inequality, Tschebyshev Inequality
Weak law of large numbers, law of large numbers, strong law of large numbers
Central Limit Theorem
Plotting
Role of n vs p
Week 10
Weak law of large numbers, Strong law of large numbers
Point estimate: Method of moments estimate, Maximum likelihood estimate
Confidence Intervals
Empirical data
Pivotal Quantity, Pivotal quantityu exponential
Central limit theorem
Week 11
Testing of Hypothesis
Week 11A
Test for Sample mean when sigma is known
Chi square - Goodness of fit test
Chi square - Test of independence

item.title: Heading 1
item.description:
Wiki
First to Make Paragraphs
Use # for heading 1. ## for heading 2





This is a sample Paragraph.


Use ** or __
Bold Text Bold Text
Use * or _
Italic Text Italic Text
Use ~~
Strikethrough Text
Use ==
Hello
Use ** and _
Hello
Use *** or ___
Hello


Use > before a text
Here is a really good quote by someone. XYZ logic you are seeing, but not getting anything... HEHE
- Sarvesh


Good
bad
is always there
dont worry

complete task
incomplete task
task
